c74object.name: meandev
c74object.digest: Calculate the mean and deviation of data over time
c74object.description: meandev is an object for calculating the mean and variance or standard deviation of a set of values over various ranges in the data's history. This makes it possible to compare these values for different ranges in time and make some assessment of how the data is changing. The age ranges are specified as having a maximum and a minimum age. The ranges may overlap. The final range is specified only in terms of maximum age and tracks the most recent data up to the specified age.

objarg.name: Mode
objarg.description:
The first argument sets the mode of meandev.
0 - last n values mode
1 - last n milliseconds mode
2 - as mode 0 but with weightings
3 - as mode 1 but with weightings

objarg.name: Mean-mode
objarg.description:
The second argument sets the mean mode of meandev.
0 - calculate means and deviations normally
1 - calculate deviations in relation to mean of means
2 - calculate mean of means (and deviations in relation to this)

objarg.name: Ages
objarg.description:
From the third argument onwards, set up to 4 age ranges (min and max)
For modes 0 and 2 the ranges are given in number of values
For modes 1 and 3 the ranges are given in milliseconds

objarg.name: Max-Age
objarg.description:
Set a final maximum age (between max and 0)
For modes 0 and 2 the ranges are given in number of values
For modes 1 and 3 the ranges are given in milliseconds

objarg.name: Deviation-mode
objarg.description:
The final argument sets the deviation mode of meandev.
0 outputs variances
1 outputs standard deviations

method.name: int
method.description:
In the left inlet: Input data in the form of an int into meandev. This data is used to calculate the means and variance/standard deviations.
In the right inlet: When the mode argument is set to 2 or 3, an int applies a weighting value to the data. This value determines the relative weighting of the data in calculating the mean and and deviation.

method.name: float
method.description:
In the left inlet: Input data in the form of a float into meandev. This data is used to calculate the means and variance/standard deviations.
In the right inlet: When the mode argument is set to 2 or 3, a float applies a weighting value to the data. This value determines the relative weighting of the data in calculating the mean and and deviation.

method.name: bang
method.description: In the right inlet: A bang causes meandev to reset its stored data.

entry.name: float
entry.description:
The number of outlets depends on the number of pairs of ages set as arguments (includng the max age).
Each pair of outlets outputs the mean and variance/standard deviation respectively and is calculated using their corresponding pair of age arguments.
